sample_response.name: Scott Weeden
sample_response.bio: Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science at Texas Tech University while simultaneously completing Texas teacher certification for General Sciences (Grades 1-12). Previously served as a Chemistry Teacher at Robert Shoemaker University, bringing practical classroom experience to academic studies. Currently assisting with the transition at the Texas Comptroller's Office as Glenn Hegar moves to his new role as Texas A&M Provost, helping to establish new leadership priorities during this organizational change. Committed to applying computer science expertise to enhance educational practices and public service initiatives.
